extendedIngredients.name: cherry tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pint cherry tomatoes (preferably assorted colors), halved

extendedIngredients.name: rosemary
extendedIngredients.original: 2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh rosemary plus 8 large sprigs
extendedIngredients.originalName: finely chopped fresh rosemary plus 8 large sprigs

extendedIngredients.name: trout filet

title: Rosemary Trout with Cherry-Tomato Sauce
summary: Rosemary Trout with Cherry-Tomato Sauce might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains approximately 60g of protein, 33g of fat, and a total of 573 calories. This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe serves 4 and costs $7.91 per serving. If you have balsamic vinegar, trout, olive oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 15 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 94%. This score is great. Similar recipes include Rosemary Trout With Cherry-tomato Salsa, Rosemary-Feta Chicken with Cherry Tomato-Olive Sauce, and Red onion, cherry tomato & rosemary fougasse.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Mix tomatoes, shallot, vinegar, and choppedrosemary in bowl. Stir in 1 tablespoon oil.Season sauce with salt and pepper.                                                                Open trout like book on work surface.Sprinkle with coarse salt and pepper. Place2 rosemary sprigs on each; fold over to close.                                                                Divide 3 tablespoons oil between 2large nonstick skillets. Place over medium-highheat. Add 2 trout to each skillet. Cooktrout until brown outside and just opaque incenter, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer toplates. Spoon sauce alongside.

steps.step: Mix tomatoes, shallot, vinegar, and choppedrosemary in bowl. Stir in 1 tablespoon oil.Season sauce with salt and pepper.
Open trout like book on work surface.
Sprinkle with coarse salt and pepper.
Place2 rosemary sprigs on each; fold over to close.
Divide 3 tablespoons oil between 2large nonstick skillets.
Add 2 trout to each skillet. Cooktrout until brown outside and just opaque incenter, about 4 minutes per side.
